definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: PolyU Milestones is The Hong Kong Polytechnic University magazine published by the Communications and Public Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 是香港理工大學刊物，由傳訊及公共事務處編印出版。

sentences.english: To assure the progress of compiling and printing numbers, the company bought a numbering machine.
sentences.chinese: 爲保證編印號碼的進度，單位買了一臺號碼機。

sentences.english: Printing student Handbooks in both Chinese and English versions.

sentences.chinese: 然而，這一數字並非是編印有誤。

sentences.english: Consider establishing a newsletter, and find other ways of publicizing the action efforts.
sentences.chinese: 考慮編印簡報，尋找宣傳行動的其他方式。

sentences.english: This is a computer print-out letter that requires no signature.
sentences.chinese: 本函爲電腦編印文件，無須簽署。

sentences.english: I printed it out and gave it to my children.
sentences.chinese: 我將它編印出來給了我的孩子們。

sentences.english: The council issued a large number of publications for free distribution regularly.
sentences.chinese: 該局定期編印並免費派發大量刊物。

sentences.english: Fitzpatrick, Sheila. The Russian Revolution. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1994.
sentences.chinese: 《俄國大革命》，牛津大學出版社編印，1994。

sentences.english: She is a scholar who EDITS Shakespeare's plays for use in schools.
sentences.chinese: 她是編印莎士比亞戲劇供學校使用的學者。

definition: variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
to revise and enlarge (a book)/to augment a purchase order
to publish (in newspapers or magazines)/to record (bookkeeping entries)
